channel.title: Do I need an unique LAN IP for the each cloned Workstation if I don't use them at a time?
channel.description:
I have a one Gateway and several cloned Workstations in my VirtualBox.
In this article /wiki/Multiple_Whonix-Workstation (section Non-Qubes-Whonix) I see the following warning:
> Each additional Whonix-Workstation ™ VM must have its own MAC address and internal LAN IP address.
I already have unique MAC addresses for the each Workstations (VirtualBox network settings). But what about unique internal LAN IPs?
Is it important only in case of using multiple Workstations at a time? Or I also have to do this if I use my Workstations separately in different time?
Thanks!

item.title: Do I need an unique LAN IP for the each cloned Workstation if I don't use them at a time?
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
mujb:

But what about unique internal LAN IPs?

Required. Must be done manually because there’s no DHCP on the GW for security reasons.

mujb:

Is it important only in case of using multiple Workstations at a time?

Yes.

Read full topic
item.source: Do I need an unique LAN IP for the each cloned Workstation if I don't use them at a time?
